page.title: 14Recreation (B)
page.content: The Golf Course in Cardross was founded in 1895 as a 6 holed course behind the railway. Then in 1904 it was moved to the other side of the main road because golfers wanted a full sized course. The Golf Club bought a bigger piece of ground. Now in 1985 there are 750 members, 80% adults and 20% juniors. It employs 10 people who either full time or part time. The majority of members are men who either live locally or in Glasgow. The Golf Club in Cardross is very important for the village. The course is very difficult, being one of the best courses in Dunbartonshire.
